prior_works.title: CARLA: An Open Urban Driving Simulator
prior_works.role: Simulator enabling collection of diverse, non-expert and hazardous driving behaviors
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim directly leverages CARLA to acquire rare, hazardous, and non-expert behaviors absent from real logs, providing the heterogeneous data distribution needed to train a reliable, action-following world model.

prior_works.title: Action-Conditional Video Prediction using Deep Networks in Atari Games
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim builds on the core idea of conditioning generative video dynamics on agent actions, updating it with modern diffusion-transformer generators and multi-signal control for driving.

prior_works.title: DiT: Scalable Diffusion Models with Transformers
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim’s video generator is a diffusion transformer, and its conditioning-integration strategies are designed around DiT-like architectures to achieve high-fidelity, controllable rollouts.

prior_works.title: ControlNet: Adding Conditional Control to Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
prior_works.role: Technique for injecting structured conditions into diffusion models
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim’s approach to integrating multiple conditioning signals (e.g., actions, routes) for controllable predictions is inspired by ControlNet-style mechanisms for effective, disentangled control.

prior_works.title: UniSim: Learning Interactive Real-World Simulators
prior_works.role: Interactive, action-conditioned world modeling from real driving data
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim extends the UniSim paradigm of interactive, action-following video world models by addressing its weakness on rare unsafe behaviors via simulator-enriched training and stronger conditioning.

prior_works.title: GAIA-1: A Generative World Model for Autonomous Driving
prior_works.role: Large-scale generative driving world model with control signals
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim advances GAIA-1–style driving world models by improving reliability under hazardous controls and training on a heterogeneous mix of real and simulated trajectories.

prior_works.title: High-Resolution Image Synthesis with Latent Diffusion Models
prior_works.role: Foundational diffusion modeling framework enabling efficient, high-fidelity generation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ReSim’s high-quality video synthesis and practical training leverage latent-space diffusion ideas that underpin modern, scalable diffusion-transformer generators.

synthesis_narrative: ReSim’s core contribution—reliable, controllable simulation of driving scenarios that follow both expert and hazardous non-expert behaviors—emerges at the intersection of action-conditioned video prediction, diffusion-transformer generation, and simulator-enhanced data curation. The action-conditioning thread originates with Oh et al. (2015), which formalized predicting future frames given actions; ReSim retains this principle but scales it to complex real-world driving. Modern diffusion modeling, particularly latent diffusion and DiT, provides the generative fidelity and scalability needed for long-horizon, photorealistic rollouts. Within this backbone, ControlNet-style conditioning demonstrates how to inject multiple structured control signals, a concept ReSim adapts to integrate actions, routes, and other cues to ensure controllability without sacrificing realism. Domain-specific precedents—UniSim and GAIA-1—show that interactive, policy-following driving world models are feasible when trained on large real-world corpora, yet they struggle with rare unsafe maneuvers that are underrepresented in logs. ReSim directly addresses this reliability gap by augmenting real demonstrations with simulator-sourced non-expert data from CARLA, broadening the behavior distribution and enabling faithful hazard-following predictions. By uniting these strands—action-conditioned dynamics, robust diffusion-transformer architectures with effective control injection, and heterogeneous training that includes simulated hazards—ReSim attains reliable open-world simulation suitable for evaluating policies under diverse and challenging driving behaviors.
